description.plain:
Henry Smithson, better known by his stage name Riton, is an England based DJ and music producer who produces electro techno, house and deep house.

Henry first gets in touch with electronic music when he attended a Rave party held in his secondary school. He started his career in the 1990s, but before getting famous, Henry was only on the underground doing parties and gigs. In 2001, he started producing electronic music in the name of [Riton, a French slang for his real name “Henry.” He has been doing that for nearly twenty years before he made the hit Rinse & Repeat, which gained major attention in the electronic music industry.

The single which released in 2016 with Nigerian singer Kah-Lo brings Riton’s career to the climax. The club hit has scored No.1 on the Shazam Dance Chart, No.6 on the Spotify Global Viral 50 and was being played throughout major radio stations after it was released.

Fake ID, which released in 2017, marked his second hit throughout the years after “Rinse & Repeat”, with a staggering 5 million plays to date on Spotify alone and still increasing.

body.plain:
Henry Smithson, better known by his stage name Riton, is an England based DJ and music producer who produces electro techno, house and deep house.

Henry first gets in touch with electronic music when he attended a Rave party held in his secondary school. He started his career in the 1990s, but before getting famous, Henry was only on the underground doing parties and gigs. In 2001, he started producing electronic music in the name of [Riton, a French slang for his real name “Henry.” He has been doing that for nearly twenty years before he made the hit Rinse & Repeat, which gained major attention in the electronic music industry.

The single which released in 2016 with Nigerian singer Kah-Lo brings Riton’s career to the climax. The club hit has scored No.1 on the Shazam Dance Chart, No.6 on the Spotify Global Viral 50 and was being played throughout major radio stations after it was released.

Fake ID, which released in 2017, marked his second hit throughout the years after “Rinse & Repeat”, with a staggering 5 million plays to date on Spotify alone and still increasing.
